item.title: Clinical Psychology | The benefits and risks of the introduction of AI
item.description:
Artificial intelligence is there to stay and its use in the field of psychology begins to be spoken. Recently, Deputy Lam Lon Wai defended its use and, in Portugal, the Order of Psychologists created the “PSIA” platform, which allows it to detect symptoms. Nuno Gomes and Goreti Lima, two resident therapists, talk about the benefits, risks and potential uses of technology
Understanding whether emotions can result in psychological forum diseases is something that is already possible to do using Artificial Intelligence (AI). The issue begins to discuss in Macao still shyly, namely through Deputy Lam Lon Wai, who in February interpelled the government about the need to apply AI tools in clinical cases with young people. HM spoke to two clinical psychologists who work with residents of Macao, in person or distance, about the benefits and risks of betting on AI. Nuno Gomes, a psychologist in a local clinic, says that “is, for now, a help, and it will always be”. "AI is an irreversible process and it is inevitable that it covers all fields of our lives, and in them is psychology and helps people. But I come from a field of psychology that is the humanist school, which is based on the relationship with the patient, so I see no great benefits, for the use of AI, because in human relationships AI does not enter," he defended. Nuno Gomes believes that AI can help in the diagnostic phase, although he thinks "the psychologist will always be the central character." "AI can be an advantage in Macao for people who have difficulty asking for help. The use of the well -defined AI, even in ethical terms, can be very useful for the beginning of a therapy. However, at this time we are not able to use AI at the level of a more complete and background therapy," he said. Nuno Gomes also recalls that for those who want to talk to someone, AI "can give the feeling that we are not alone and that is someone on the other side." It is a feeling that is still "strange", but "in the future will no longer be, because AI will be part of our days." The psychologist believes that AI "may work as long as it is ethically well regulated and can help in brief therapies, but always as a complement to a larger process." Goreti Lima, who has lived in Macao, continues to do clinical psychology at a distance with residents living in the territory. It is more skeptical in relation to the use of AI, arguing that human relationship is always fundamental for quality monitoring. “Therapy is made in the relationship and these applications do not contemplate it. I think very well that we can use AI to diagnose, see symptoms, but this we can also do with a book or article. ChatgPT already tells us some things in the area of ​​psychology, possible analysis of symptoms. AI helps in this process, but then the rest works in the therapeutic relationship. Data are stored like? Recommendations in Portugal In a written interpeação directed to the Government of MSAR, Deputy Lam Lon Wai questioned whether there will be “cooperation” between government departments, technological companies and local academic institutions in the use of AI in the area of ​​mental health. However, Goreti Lam regrets that deputy "do not speak in the figure of the psychologist." “Academics have a different experience from psychologists and therapists, who have acquired this experience in practical terms. This develops over time. All these questions have to be thought when applying AI. AI can identify what the person has and even use, but then we have to take into account deontological conditions. Undersisted, ”he added. Portugal is one of the countries where the application of AI in Psychology begins to gain some form, to the point of the Order of Portuguese Psychologists (OPP) has created the online “Psia” tool, which allows you to state a series of symptoms and reach a diagnosis. Personal data appear to be protected with the introduction, on the website, the citizen card number, with the digital mobile key. In addition, OPP has created a manual of good practices, entitled “The Human Factor in Artificial Intelligence - Strategic Recommendations for Sustainability”, which states that there are “virtual therapists who can identify, in communication with people, emotional difficulties that facilitate deliberate psychological education”, as well as enhancing “the learning of techniques and skills that aim, for example, to reduce anxiety”. In addition, the OPP document concludes that "some studies suggest that these chatbots, developed based on validated therapeutic models, may be effective in reducing depressive symptoms and even that some people establish a bond similar to that of a human relationship." However, “these evidence is not consolidated and security-related (people and data), eventual dependence on technologies and the responsiveness of support given to different psychological difficulties are not clarified”, it reads. Regarding PSIA, it is referred to the OPP website that "on very specific or complex issues should not be used in tasks that require specialized judgment and evaluation, deep technical analysis or professional counseling." It is also clarified that the answers provided are based on “available documents and information” until July 31 last year, and PSIA “does not replace the role of a psychologist or any supervision activities”. In the case of Hong Kong, some solutions are also beginning to emerge, which motivated, by the way, the interpellation of Deputy Lam Lon Wai. This is the case of Hollo, a mobile phone application developed in connection with the University of Hong Kong (UHK) that aims to “make mental health care more accessible to patients, service platforms and organizations”. Hollo uses AI power and technologies to bring clinical practices standardized to another level of productivity, intelligence and digital connectivity. According to Cameron Van Breda, Hollo's CEO and co-founder, the company aims to be "an easily accessible tool in stress times, offering analysis and friendship suggestions for better mental health exercises." In practical terms, “focuses on young people from 12 to 24 years old, works in English and Chinese and introduce them to therapy and counseling practices through mindfulness activities and daily games,” reads UHK's website. Almost the same Asked about Macao's mental health landscape, Nuno Gomes understands that he persists "some conservatism and ignorance not only in what is AI and areas where one can apply, but also what psychology can do." "Psychology is here to help people and in the context of Macao there is no such understanding yet. This stigma prevents many people from seeking help and AI can give this support. However, the older population is still very unaware of the operation of AI, but the younger people will increasingly resort to this type of platforms," ​​he said. In general terms, "the overview of mental health has changed little from the pandemic," because "in general, people do not feel the need to express emotions and since they are encouraged to keep emotions, that when they are bad and stored a long time, they start to do harm. People do not know how to express them out of shame or guilt." Goreti Lima also understands that in the area of ​​mental health there is still some ignorance in Macau.

item.title: Social Security | Coutinho defends the regime update
item.description: Deputy José Pereira Coutinho requires the government to review the Social Security System to cease to exist discrimination with the elderly with disabilities. In the written interplies handed over to the Executive, the deputy and president of the Macao Public Function Association (ATFPM) spoke of one of the allegedly discriminatory situations, noting that “a citizen who, since youth, receives a subsidy for disability and reaches the elderly, should have the right to accumulate it with the elderly pension”. In addition, Coutinho states that he has been confronted, through the Citizens Care Office, with "a growing number of support requests from disabled residents, especially those who, reaching the elderly, are faced with a significant reduction in income." "This situation proves to be particularly alarming to those who are not entitled to the pensions of the elderly," he said. According to the deputy, “disabled citizens who reach legal age to be considered elderly are, by definition, individuals who have long -term impediments, physical, mental, intellectual or sensory, limiting their full participation in society, on equal conditions for other elderly”. Review the law In this sense, the deputy says it is “imperative” that “the current norms governing the granting of pensions to disabled citizens who affect the elderly”, since “it is essential to ensure that all citizens, regardless of their condition, have access to rights that promote dignity and quality of life”. "Considering that the relevant legislation is fundamental, in order to ensure that disabled citizens have the right to review the pension to the elderly, I question whether the government will update and modernize the current social security regime that is manifestly disabled taking into account the decade and a half of validity of Law 4/2010 [Social Security Regime]," he said.

item.title: Work | Leong Sun Iok wants protection for “false collaborators”
item.description:
The Fan deputy warns of the abuse of the independent work regime, which can be used by employer entities to avoid obligations, such as the acquisition of insurance
Deputy Leong Sun IOK intends that the government present new measures to protect “false employees”, that is, workers who are hired for independent services on paper, but in practice they are under the authority of the employer. The subject was approached through a written interpellation, released yesterday by the office of the legislator linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom). According to the scenario reported by Leong Sun Iok, it is becoming increasingly normal in Macau employers to resort to false employees, as "the market is limited and many people can only work this way." Without options, workers end up accepting the proposals. Under normal conditions, employees provide a service, and can choose when and how they work, being the most relevant to present the result for which they were hired. However, under the conditions reported by the deputy, in practice, workers are required to follow working hours established by the boss and his instructions, typical characteristics of the dependent worker regime. For the bosses, although this performance is illegal, the regime has the advantage of allowing expenses arising from the guarantee of labor rights. As such, Leong Sun Iok asks the executive to "verify that employers are resorting to this possibility as a means to run away from the responsibilities and duties of the employment relationship." One more study The deputy of the parliamentary bench of Faom asks to follow the example of the interior of China, to increase the protection of these workers. To this end, it argues that it is necessary to “study how to ensure workers' professional guarantees on their own and liberal professionals”, and “encourage employers to acquire work insurance for their workers with service contracts”. The member of the Legislative Assembly also asks the government to be aware of the emergence of “new employment modalities”. At the interpetement, it is also requested to perform “an inquiry into the number and types of workers on their own and existing liberal professionals” in the territory to “safeguard the professional rights and interests of workers”. On the other hand, Leong indicates that in Macau there is always an employment contract, regardless of the designation of the contract, when it is required to the “collaborator” who is “available” to perform the duties at the employer's request. Therefore, it asks the government if it will issue clear instructions and strengthen disclosure actions on the Macao labor regime to “avoid breach of law by employers and safeguard workers' rights and interests”.

item.title: Cotai | Government declined concerts to the air-free

Leong explained that this was mainly due to the fact that the proposals do not have a highly highly high audience to justify the use of the concert zone to the free air, which has a capacity of 50,000 people. item.title: Water | Law chan u asks for balanced saving measures

In this case, the deputy intends to know how to promote the savings of water resources. “If the government is not intended to define a new water savings program, which plans have to continuously reinforce water resources and promote the construction of a water saving city?” He asks.

item.title: LIMITS OF WORK
item.description: On March 17, the Hong Kong Census and Statistics Department released data showing that approximately 12,900 people worked on digital food delivery platforms and other goods over the past year. 52.5 percent of these workers are between 15 and 39 years old, more than half are less than 40 and 24.2 percent over 50 years. 64.7 percent of respondents stated that this work is their main source of income, 61 percent receives less than $ 5,000 from Hong Kong (HKD) per month and 37.1 percent earns more than 15,000 hkd a month. 53.9 percent work less than 44 hours a week, 24.9 percent over 44 hours per week and 21.2 percent of these workers claim not to have a fixed time. 68.6 percent work only for a delivery platform every day. 91.3 percent of respondents say they have started working in this business because it is easy to enter, having a flexible working method and having great control over methods and procedures. 98.2 percent claim to have more maneuver field to balance work with personal life. 45 percent are attracted to this work due to salary. Other data previously issued by the Hong Kong government show that the average salary of these workers was 22,000 USD between October and December 2024. By comparison, only 37.1 percent earn more than 15,000 USD, showing that they usually receive wages below average. Office employees in Hong Kong usually work from 9am to 6pm during the week and another four hours on Saturdays, which means a total of 49 hours of weekly work. Excluding the break from an hour for lunch from Monday to Friday, exactly 44 hours. Since 53.9 percent of distributors work less than 44 hours per week, it is reasonable that their salaries will be lower than the market average. 98.2 percent of people who make deliveries say they do this service by giving them more room to balance their work with family life. This demonstrates that the new generation pay more attention to the balance between work and personal life, a different phenomenon from the “tele-work” that emerged during the epidemic. The “tele-work” means working from home because it is difficult to evaluate the limit between work and family life. As people working on delivery platforms can control their working hours, the problem of defining the border between work and leisure is very small. The three main limits that define the exercise of labor functions are psychological, temporal and physical. Psychological boundaries are rules created by individuals who determine specific thoughts, behaviors and emotions, which means that one should have a rational attitude when working and an emotional attitude when one is in family. Time limits mean defining working hours, turning off duties outside this time, and dedicating this extra labor time to home and family. The physical limit is defined by the workplace. When you go to the office you will work, when you leave the work ended. The statistical data of delivery platforms show that people choose to collaborate with them mainly because they have more room to control their hours and work model. This phenomenon indicates that the new generation values ​​the existence of boundaries to work time and, in terms of psychological limits, seeks to have more control over their work. In the post-epicide era, it is given greater importance to the balance between professional and family career. Limits theory helps companies understand and better manage work and family boundaries, thus achieving better balance and allowing workers' quality of life to improve. In Hong Kong, delivery platform distributors earn less. Although it has a better notion of the limits of work and a happier family life, material goods that can give to the family are limited. These workers need to achieve balance between family life and material goods. From a business point of view, giving workers more space and flexibility, as well as broader borders, will help recruit a new generation of employees. item.title: Let us be practical
item.description: The annual plenary session of the National Popular Congress and the National Committee of the Chinese people's Political Advisory Conference, held in Beijing, has recently ended. One of the main concerns of Macau representatives was the “Integration of Macao and Hengqin”. I transcribe an excerpt from a conversation I heard as I had breakfast, "Are you going to buy an apartment in Hengqin?" "No, if I wanted a house, I bought it in Zhuhai, because it gets closer to Macau." Living in Hengqin certainly has its advantages. Many students from China who study at Macao universities live in Hengqin and catch the bus to the mud every day. There are also many residents and newly arrived people living in Hengqin for reasons related to work or children's school. But even if they come to live in Hengqin, which has an area of ​​106.46 square kilometers, 100,000 people, or even more than 200,000, is still not much. At the time when the housing fractions of the “new neighborhood of Macau” were for sale, there were many restrictions, which were being raised over time on the grounds of “development policy changes with development”. But deep down, they are "policies that give in to reality." In fact, whether it is politics or economics, the practical sense is imposed. I am not opposed to the improvement of the legal framework aimed at the “integration of Macao and Hengqin,” as it is necessary to clarify the difference between “in -depth cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin” and “New Zone of Hengqin”. If we think about the efforts that are being developed for the “integration of Macao and Hengqin,” we will see that Macau has played a more active role than Guangdong Province. In the case of Macao, I suggest that hengqin circulation of all types of vehicles from the city is allowed. However, how can Hengqin attract residents of Macao to live there and contribute to their development if there is not even a public parking park for Macao vehicles at the Hengqin border post? If there are those who ask that the “Macao vehicle circulation policy in Guangdong province” has already made it difficult to survive companies in the North Zone of Macao, then if these vehicles are allowed to circulate in Hengqin, will this not even have negative consequences for Macao's economy? In my opinion, the introduction of reforms in the commercial sector is just a way to get out of your current situation. It is a priority to end the monopoly of the commercial sector, to open the economy to different markets, to develop and use the unoccupied land as much as possible, while reducing the negative impact of “road works” on companies and store owners. For example, the Jockey Club of Macao has been closed since last year and the clues have been covered with grass. However, the Macao government has not announced any development plan for the site, thus being wasted valuable resources. Perhaps the Macao government can be inspired by the operational management of Hong Kong's “Kai Tak Sports Park”. As for this subject, the Macao Executive can grant one of six resort and leisure companies integrated the Jockey Club's land development and management rights for a given period of time, which can somehow help create a new commercial zone that attracts the consumption of more tourists. It would also be important to create political incentives and/or flexibility of restrictions on companies to attract traders to settle in the old neighborhoods and community neighborhoods throughout the city. If we look at the “reordering of the amendment street and four other streets of the parish of Santo António” that took place a few years ago, and compare the agitated environment that existed before and after reordering, it becomes evident that the “ideas” that come out of those who “are sitting in their offices” have to be put to the test to be effective. We impose on reality only usually results in disaster. The “Integration of Hengqin and Macau” is an ambitious venture that the homeland has entrusted to Macao. Before Hengqin is officially under the jurisdiction of Macao, the most important thing is to preserve and develop Macau.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence in Macao Culinary
item.description: "Macau's Opulent Fine Dining Scene is Using Ai to Tackle Sustainability: How Restaurants in Galaxy Macau, Sands China and Grand Lisbon Are Leading The Green March Forward." Amanda Sheppard Macao's cuisine scene, a region known for its vibrant mixture of Portuguese and Chinese influences, is taking its first steps in a technological revolution with the integration of Artificial Intelligence (IA). AI entered the world of cooking as a tool of efficiency and innovation. In Macao, a territory with a diverse culinary heritage, AI application may reshape traditional approaches to food. The fusion of advanced technology with rich culinary traditions creates a unique landscape, offering both opportunities and challenges. The historical background of the kitchen in Macau enhance the unique identity of the region. Macau was a Portuguese colony for over four centuries, creating an intricate mix of Asian and European culinary practices. This mixture formed a rich culinary tapestry, with dishes such as cod and minchi macanese to gain local and international fame. As we examine this story, we appreciate the unique features of Macao's kitchen, which AI technologies are now prepared to improve. In recent years, the growing adoption of AI technologies in the global gastronomic scene has marked a significant change. Restaurants began to use AI for various purposes, such as improving customer experience and rationalizing food preparation processes. AI -powered chatbots, for example, entered the world of food services, providing customers immediate assistance to navigate the menus, order, and make reservations. This technology eliminates linguistic barriers, allowing tourists and local inhabitants to get involved with culinary offers smoothly. In addition, the food preparation sector is watching the influence of robotics and intelligent equipment. AI algorithms can optimize cooking processes by analyzing data on ingredients, cooking times and consumer preferences. This data -based approach allows bosses to focus on creativity by minimizing the risks of human error. For example, Michelin restaurants such as Chief Tam Seasons, SJM's Robochon Au Dôme, Galaxy's Walk Kitchen and The Londoner's Churchill’s Table are all stimulating change and received praise for using AI to improve operational efficiency and maintain high food quality standards. Heads António Coelho, Sally Jimenez and Cristiano Tavares do Lisboeta study the introduction of AI into their culinary practices. Mizumi's chief André Chiang is making progress in the world of culinary with technology. Known for his innovative gastronomy approach, chief Chiang has taken advantage of AI in his culinary developments. Its Japanese restaurant at Wynn Macau uses smart technologies to improve traditional kitchen techniques. When using AI tools to analyze customer reactions and service standards, it can continually improve dining experience. The prospects for the role of AI in Macao cuisine range from the professionals of the sector. Some bosses adopt the integration of technology, facing it as a way of overcoming the boundaries of cooking. The supporters argue that AI can help maintain the cultural essence of Macaense food, while innovating with new flavors and presentation styles. By analyzing large amounts of culinary data, AI may suggest unique combinations of ingredients that could not occur to human heads. On the other hand, there are those who express concern about the potential loss of authenticity. Critics argue that trusting technology can harm traditional kitchen methods and the human touch that is an integral part of the culinary arts. Its point of view underlines the importance of preserving heritage and emotional links associated with handmade food. Despite these different perspectives, the thesis remains that AI's role in Macao's culinary industry can represent a fascinating evolution and not a substitution of human ability. (continues)

item.title: Galaxy | G-Dragon starred in two concerts in June
item.description:
The Galaxy Arena, one of the main show rooms in the territory, is preparing to receive two concerts from the South Korean rapper and composer G-Dragon, integrated into the “Ubermensch” tour, which also goes through other Asian cities. This is the opportunity for the local audience to see and listen to one of the sleepless names of South Korean music
G-Dragon, Kwon Ji-Yong's stage name, is a 36-year-old South Korean rapper and songwriter who, in June, named after 7 and 8, comes Macao for two shows at the Cotai Galaxy Arena, who promise to delight fans or lovers of South Korea music. The two shows are part of the “übermensch” tour, which means superhuman, and which goes through several Asian cities, namely Tokyo, on May 10 and 11; Bulacan, in the Philippines, on May 17; Osaka, on May 25 and 26 and then Taipei, Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta, in July. Highlighted by Forbes magazine in 2016, as the most influential person in Asia's entertainment industry under 30, G-Dragon is linked to the world of the show and the arts since childhood, as his first television appearance took place on the children's “BBO BBO BBO” children's program. At the age of six he joined the children's group “Litlle Roo'ra”. Over the years he bet on rap, also becoming a composer, entrepreneur and fashion designer. His connection to hip hop was gradual, having integrated in 2006 the boys-band "Big Bang", releasing the solo album "Heartbreaker" in 2009, which included a song of the same name. Success felt right there, as it was recognized as the “album of the year” at Mnet Asian Music Awards. The following year, 2010, was already part of another musical group, the “T.O.P.”, which released an album of the same name, also another of success. The first G-Dragon worldwide diffress took place in 2013, calling itself “One of a Kind World Tour”, and that same year it released its second studio album, “Coup d'Atat”, which was also worth recognizing criticism. With regard to the musical style, G-Dragon says he is inspired by the Wu-Tang Clan group and the American Pharrell Williams, which is his "musical hero." Other hip-hop names, such as Kanye West, count on your reference list. A kind of revolution According to Tatler Asia magazine, Kwon Ji-Yong managed to innovate and “transcend the traditional borders of Asian pop star”, turning everything into “creative gold” into musical terms. It is classified by this publication as a chameleon in the music world, and in almost 20 years of career it was “a virtuous musician, provocative of fashion and an innovative entrepreneur” who caught the attention of fans. It presents “avant-garde clothing” that wear “an artistic genius whose professional trajectory permanently altered the DNA of Korean entertainment”, writes Tatler on G-Dragon. About the fashion designer aspect, it is described that G-Dragon does much more than wearing such “avant-garde clothing”, turning them into “cultural statements”, having been Chanel's first Asian global ambassador. In the fashion week in Paris, the South Korean rapper dared to wear women's tweed coats, transposing the limits of the gender. G-Dragon recently adopted an aesthetics called the "Grandma-Core", which includes the use of head scarves and a red-haired hair. It may or may not shock, but the style remains.

item.title: Tickets for sale since Saturday to the 35th edition of FAM
item.description: Since Saturday, tickets are for sale for the 35th edition of the Macao Arts Festival (FAM), which runs between April 25 and May 31, and this year's central theme is the idea of ​​“growth”. It is presented to the public, with organization of the Cultural Institute (IC), a set of 15 shows that cover theater, Chinese opera, dance, circus, music and visual arts. This edition of FAM starts with “The Life of Pi”, a theatrical production of West End of London and Broadway, which, with FAM, begins the first tour of East Asia in Macao. The show blends state -of -the -art techniques with impressive puppets techniques to explore the meaning of life and the theme of courage. Moreover, in order to show the idea of ​​“East-Kidade Meeting, Asia in Harmony”, linked to the “Culture City of East Asia 2025-Macao, China” initiative, two shows are presented. They are “Deling and Cixi”, a collaboration between Beijing and Hong Kong teams that recreates intimate narratives in the court's private rooms during the Qing dynasty; and also the Cantonense opera concert “Discorting Harmonious Voices”. This musical show is presented by the Chinese orchestra of Macao along with notable figures of the Cantonense opera, such as Zeng Xiaomin and Wen Ruqing, making known to Macau's public the culture of Lingnan. Another of the highlights of the 35th edition of FAM is the show “A Phoenix Louca”, from the Cantonense opera troupe of Foshan. It is an adaptation of a classic play centered on the life of the talented playwright Kong Yu-Kau, which will provide viewers with a totally new experience, maintaining the dramatic intensity of the piece and ingeniously integrating innovative elements of the Cantonense opera. Japan Premiere FAM also features the original Japanese musical “Kiki, the Apprentice of Witch”, which in Macau will have its debut outside Japan. In this show, it presents itself with a new musical repertoire and a production team that will faithfully capture the charm of the homonymous work and animation. Local audiences can also see the Tago, from South Korea, which feature “the shaman's beat”, a show that will combine traditional percussion techniques with a modern aesthetic.

item.title: World Book Day | IC organizes “Book Exchange” and various activities
item.description:
April is a month to celebrate the reading. On the 23rd, the “World Book Day” takes place, and in this context, the government, through the Cultural Institute, will organize a series of programs to promote reading, such as the exchange of old books, and other activities
The “World Book Day” is celebrated on April 23rd and, therefore, the Cultural Institute (IC) organizes activities such as the “Book Exchange”. In various places of the city there will also be reading points, in an activity designated by “joint reading month throughout the city of Macau 2025”, that is, throughout April. The “Book Exchange” initiative has begun, notably with regard to the process of collecting books that people can have in their homes and who want to exchange for others through a point system. The delivery of old works can be done until April 13, and residents can deliver their collections of books that meet the conditions required in the 11 public libraries under the IC aegis, including the Macao Central Library, the Sir Robert Ho Tung library, the mud library and the Seac Pai Van library, among others. This year, for the first time, there will be an electronic system of points, and each book will be classified according to the original price, being attributed a unit for every 10 patacas or to a fraction of not less than five patacas. The maximum score per book or collection is 100 units. In collection of electronic points, residents can use the application “my library”. The exchange of books will take place on April 26 and 27, with the points obtained to be replaced by the new works chosen, to the counters of the Macao Cultural Center and the Auditorium of the Seac Pai Van Activities Center. The IC describes that, in the book exchange system, no textbooks and textbooks, magazines, pornographic publications, damaged books or non -original books are allowed. Readings in the city Another activity of promoting the book, is the “reading points”, a program where you can register the entities or associations of the territory. The aim is to “share reading time in community neighborhoods, increase participation and broaden reading coverage to the public”. Thus, interested parties can submit their proposals for the organization of “reading points” by April 30, and these “points” can be organized in stores, restaurants, schools, educational centers, associations, companies and offices, with no format limitations. Participating entities must organize reading activities by their own initiative from April 1st to 30th and present photographs and the number of participants after the activities. Relevant photographs will be published on the thematic electronic page of libraries and on the cultural pages of IC on social networks, “so that more residents can feel the charm of reading,” explains the IC.

item.title: Legionella | Tourist in serious condition
item.description: A 58 -year -old tourist is in serious condition due to a Legionella infection, known as Legionaries' disease. The infection was diagnosed on Saturday at the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center, and the patient has a history of chronic diseases. According to the report presented by the health authorities, the man traveled inland with his family on 10 March. On the other side of the border went to the doctor, after having had fever but did not show improvements. He returned to Macao on March 19, having a shortage of breath, which made it entry into the Conde São Januário Hospital Center. On March 20, the patient resorted to hospital medical assistance, having been diagnosed with pneumonia in both lungs, which led to the need to connect to the mechanical fan. The next day, the analyzes to the expectoration presented a positive result for Legionella, with complications for respiratory failure. According to the SS, "currently, the patient is considered severe, and still needs respiratory support by mechanical fan." Authorities also indicated that family members did not have any symptom of malaise.

item.title: Macau Pass | Thousands of elderly people carried a card for discounts
item.description:
Early in the early hours of the morning, seniors formed lines at the door of the services to change or carry Macau Pass cards and access the discounts of the great consumption award. Until 1pm, more than 22,200 elderly people had already enjoyed the benefits of the consumption incentive program
Even before opening the doors, a line with about half hundred people was at the entrance of the Macau Pass Service Center in the Preta Areia, announcing the beginning of another round of the consumption award, which began yesterday. Before starting the initiative to distribute consumer coupons to residents, to boost local businesses in neighborhoods away from tourist circuits, more than 10,000 residents asked to change Macau Pass to the elderly, 6,000 of which already had the card ready to use. The rest, in addition to residents who wanted to charge the card to access the 300 -Patacas automatic discount and start benefiting from the 50 percent discount on purchases, have been hosted on Macau Pass stores, as well as the various service stations to carry the cards. The Director of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Yau Yun Wah, revealed that until 1 pm yesterday, more than 22,200 elderly people had already taken advantage of discounts under the initiative, according to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau. The official said the process was running without problems. However, some elderly people waiting in the center of the center of Macau Pass in the black sand indicated that the earlier opening of the store would have made life easier for residents. An elderly woman said to the public broadcaster that she took off to the store to receive the new card, but that the place was full of residents who wanted to carry the card, see her balance, order second cards of cards, which resulted in a situation chaotic. In the immediate vicinity of the Macau Pass Service Center in the Preta Areia, the resident line clogged buildings of buildings, shops and parking parks. Attention to fraud The DSEDT director also stated that the government will be aware of fraudulent activities during the consumer incentive campaign and that a supervision mechanism was created together with financial institutions with payment applications to prevent consumers from buying something online to access the draw and then cancel the transaction. If activities of this genre are detected, residents will be prevented from participating in the coupon draw for the fraudulent transaction. The president of the Macao Commercial Association, Frederico MA Chi Ngai, was optimistic about the impact of the major consumption award on small and medium enterprises. The leader of the association that organizes the initiative with the government advanced to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau that about a hundred traders plans to add a discount campaign to the consumer incentive program, and that more traders are expected to follow the example.

item.title: Maternity | APPLIED ATTRIBUTION OF FAMILY ASSEMBLY
item.description:
Given the fall of birth, the associations ask the government of Sam Hou Fai to increase the number of support to families. In addition to the birth allowance, currently 5,418 Patacas, the creation of a family allowance and the extent of maternity and paternity licenses are asked
The General Association of Macao Women and the People's Youth Association have defended the assignment of families' allowances to help local families face increasing financial charges. Through a statement, Loi I Weng, vice president of the Association of Women, indicated that there are currently about 23 provinces in the interior to distribute subsidies. For example, the city Hefei, in Anhui province, distributes a single allowance to couples with two or three children, with a value from 2,000 Renminbis to 5,000 Renminbis. In turn, the authorities of the city Jinan, in the province of Shandong, distribute monthly support to families who have two or three children of 600 Renminbis per child, until they have three years. In Macao, Loi I Weng acknowledged that there is a birth allowance, currently in the amount of 5,418 patacas. However, LOI argues that the amount must be increased and the distribution of a family allowance must be considered, having as reference the value of the allowance for caregivers or the family of civil servants, which have the value of 2,175 patacas and 940 patacas, respectively. For its part, the vice president of the Tam Sio Pang Youth Association also defended the idea of ​​childhood assistance. Heard by the newspaper or Mun, the head of the Macao's Subordinate Alliance Association suggested that the government should follow the practice of the Hohhot city, the capital of the Autonomous Region of Mongolia Interior, which offers a unique subsidy worth 10,000 Renminbis to couples who have a child. When couples have two children receive about 50,000 Renminbis over 5 years, and if they have three children receive 100,000 Renminbis over 10 years. Other requests In addition to the subsidy, associations officials argued that it is also important for the government to launch other measures to create a “more favorable environment” to increased birth rate. Loi I Weng suggested to the government to subsidize companies to implement work measures to support workers' families. In addition, the official considers that the government extend the license of maternity and paternity so that residents have less concerns about birth. Tam Sio Pang also wants the extent of maternity and paternity license and argues that maternity leave should be increased to 90 days compared to 70 days. Tam Sio Pang also suggested that the government increase vacancies in subsidized day care centers, as well as a gradual integration of child care services into the free education system.

item.title: Man accused of domestic violence hurts two police officers
item.description: One resident wounded two police with a knife while trying to resist a detention. The case happened on Thursday after the man was the subject of a new ex-wife complaint for two theft crimes. Already last year he had been accused of domestic violence. According to the newspaper or Mun, the Judiciary Police (PJ) was able to stop the man on Thursday after receiving a complaint for the ex-wife's theft. The alleged criminal was arrested near the vicinity of the former partner's housing. When he realized that he was going to be arrested, the man tried to escape and used a knife to resist, slightly hurting two of the agents. According to the contours of the case, after the divorce, the victim went to live alone in the Nam Van area. Man was applied as a measure of coercion the prohibition of contact with women, due to physical aggression, which will have happened in January. However, on 25 February, the suspect violated the coercion measure, and went to the victim's house to discuss money issues. That day he physically assaulted the woman, besides having pointed to him a knife. The attacker also locked the woman at home for 31 hours. Before leaving, he stole a suitcase of 9,000 patacas that was sold by the suspect in the interior of China for 2,000 Renminbis. On the 18th of this month, the man returned to his wife's house, took advantage of the fact that the door was not locked and asked him for money again. Once again he kidnapped the woman in the apartment for 15 hours, forcing her to apply for a 5,000-pass loan from a friend. The case was referred to the MP for the crimes of forbidden weapon, theft, kidnapping, resistance and coercion, qualified offense to physical integrity and domestic violence. Appeal to protection After becoming public, the General Association of Macao Women's Women came to ask the government to improve the protection measures provided for in the Domestic Violence Prevention and Combat Law. For long years, this association has taken an abstention position in the face of the possibility of allowing the police to investigate the crimes of domestic violence without a complaint of the victims. The director of the association's Lai Yuen Solidarity Center, Wong Law Law, came to the authorities to review the victims' protection measures during the proceedings that have not yet been tried, but where there were complaints, to ensure effective protection of the victims. Wong Law Lei also highlighted the need for the authorities to investigate well the reason that led to the woman had not filed a complaint earlier, tolerating the aggressions.

item.title: Technology | More families with internet access in 2024
item.description: Last year, about 97.7 percent of household aggregates sde macau accessed the internet, equivalent to 200,200 household aggregates, a total of 205,000 families. Data on the use of the Internet in Macau were revealed by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC) and represent a growth of 0.4 percentage points in annual terms. About 99.4 percent of household aggregates who accessed the internet used the mobile network. The number of Internet users in Macau was 610,300, plus 13,000 people, a growth of 2.2 percent compared to the year 2023. Approximately 91.4 percent of users accessed the internet daily, with the penetration rate increasing 1.2 percentage points to 94 percent. The Internet penetration rate increased by 1.2 percentage points to 94 percent of the population for 2023. The rate of individuals aged 65 or over, recorded the most remarkable growth of 3.5 percentage points, causing 81.3 percent of the elderly to use the internet. As for purposes, most users aimed to use communication applications or social networks, a total of 578,600 users. Use for entertainment (547,300 users) and online banking services or mobile payments (457,400) was followed.

item.title: Demography | Macaense population in San Francisco surpasses Macau
item.description:
A study released by a Chinese researcher concludes that, currently, the population of Macanese and Luso-Asia that resides in the area of ​​San Francisco Bay in the United States is larger than that of Macao
"There are about 70,000 macanese and Luso-Asia to reside in San Francisco, which is more than the number in Macao," researcher Leong Wong Un NA was told Lusa, who presented last Thursday at the University of Macao, the book "Macanese and Luso-Assian in the San Francisco Bay Area" from 1940 to 1950, a title that results from his doctoral thesis. According to the latest censuses held in Macao in 2021, only 13,021 residents in Macau had Portuguese ancestry, representing 1.9 percent of the total population. The data also reveal that 6,668 people, 1 percent of the total population, had Chinese and Portuguese descent, characteristics usually used to define the Macanese community. The Portuguese Leadership Council of the United States has a total population of 1,454,262 with Portuguese ancestry. According to Leong, the Macanese, some of which had departed to various regions of Asia in the nineteenth century, Luso-Asian and the Portuguese in Asia, emigrated to the United States from Macao in the twentieth century, due to political and economic reasons, choosing as the main destination of the São Francisco Bay in California. The Language Question Leong Wong Un NA, a Chinese who grew up in Macao and says maintaining a close relationship with the Macanese community, has many family members resident in San Francisco, including parents and siblings.
